title: Confirmation of U.S.-China trade talks buoys shares, investor spirits
text: Asian shares extended gains on Thursday and U.S. stock futures jumped after China said it will hold trade talks with the United States in early October, raising hopes they can de-escalate their trade war before it inflicts further damage on the global economy.

title: U.S., China agree to renew trade talks; stock futures shoot up
text: The U.S. and China will meet in early October for renewed trade talks, China's Ministry of Commerce announced early Thursday, local time.

title: Dow futures jump 200 points as China and US agree to meet for trade talks
text: U.S. futures jumped Wednesday evening on the back of news that the U.S. and China had agreed to meet in early October for another round of negotiations.

title: Jerome Powell to speak on future interest rate policy in Switzerland
text: Fed Chairman Jerome “Jay” Powell will speak on Friday in Switzerland. Wall Street always hopes that he will tip off future interest rate policy.

title: Oil prices slip after surprise build in US inventories
text: Oil prices fell on Thursday, giving up some of the strong gains of the previous session, after an industry report showed U.S. crude stockpiles rose last week, against analyst expectations of a decline.

title: China and US agree to meet in October for trade negotiations: Chinese Ministry of Commerce
text: China's Ministry of Commerce said Thursday that the leaders of the U.S. and Chinese trade talks held a phone call in the morning and agreed to meet in early October for another round of negotiations.

title: Big investment banks have worst start to year since 2006
text: The world's largest investment banks have had their worst start to a year since 2006, according to the latest data published by industry analyst Coalition on Thursday.

title: A tale of two economies: The Beige Book shows both sides
text: The Beige Book seems to show we have two distinct economies going in this country.

title: 2019 Theme Of 'Slowing But Growing' Continues
text: Don't be surprised to see both economic and earnings growth rates slow from the torrid pace they set in 2018 and likely slow down further in 2020.

title: Stocks end higher as fears of conflict in Hong Kong, disorderly Brexit recede
text: U.S. stocks rallied on Wednesday, mostly winning back ground lost on Tuesday, after Hong Kong's chief executive withdrew a controversial extradition bill that sparked months of protests and as fears that the United Kingdom would leave the European Union without an exit agreement faded, after Parliament voted to require Prime Minister Boris Johnson to ask the European Union to extend the deadline for leaving beyond Oct. 31 if a deal isn't reached by then.

title: US Indexes Rebound to Close Higher Wednesday (Sep 04)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 26,355.47 on Wednesday with a gain of 237.45 points or 0.91%.

title: Commerce Dept announces new steel tariffs on China, Mexico
text: FOX Business'' Liz Claman reports on the latest steel tariffs imposed on China and Mexico.

title: Trump says US ‘not doing business with Huawei’
text: President Trump on Wednesday declined to directly address Chinese tech company Huawei’s allegations of US cyberattacks, as he called the matter a “national security concern.” “Huawei is a big concern of our military, of our intelligence agencies, and we are not doing business with Huawei,” the president told reporters at the White House.

title: Wall Street rises on strong Chinese data, Hong Kong and Brexit news
text: Wall Street's main indexes rebounded on Wednesday, after robust economic data from China, easing tensions in Hong Kong and British lawmakers' approval of a law to delay Brexit provided a dose of optimism to investors worried about global growth.

title: Global stocks rally, U.S. Treasury yield curve steepens on upbeat geopolitical news

title: Consider Risk When Building a Proper Bond Portfolio
text: While bonds have been the default safe haven amid the recent volatility in the equities market, it can be daunting to look at all the options, such as government debt and corporate bonds. One way to go about building a proper bond portfolio is to consider the risks first and foremost.

title: How To Find Top Stocks In A Choppy Market
text: Between trade war and yield curve headlines, investors have been on a bumpy ride lately. The secret is to focus on stocks with relative strength lines at new highs.

title: U.S. trade deficit shrinks; shortfall with China still large
text: The U.S. trade deficit narrowed slightly in July, but the gap with China, a focus of the Trump administration's "America First" agenda, surged to a six-month high.
